sim.author: Original by David Culp (FDM), Innis Cunningham(3d), Heiko Schulz (3D and Panel), Emmanuel Baranger(3d) - Current Version by e-pilot, Skyop, Soitanen

help.title: Boeing 737-300
help.text:
Keys: Del = Thrust Reverse d = TO/GA button Shift-D = AutoThrottle Disengage Ctrl-D = AutoPilot Disengage
Engine Start: Apply electrical power with APU Gen switches 1 and 2 (overhead) Turn on all fuel pumps (overhead) Click Engine Start Selector knob (forward row of Overhead Panel) Selector will move to GND position - observe engine instruments Wait for N2 to achieve 25% (about 10 seconds) Raise Idle/Cutoff selector lever to IDLE position (small levers behind throttles) Engine Start Selector knob will reset back to off automatically. Wait for engine to stabilize. Repeat procedure for second engine. Turn off APU Gen 1 and 2
Engine Shutdown: Lower throttles to idle. Lower Idle/Cutoff selector lever to CUTOFF position. Turn off fuel pumps.
Take off precedure: Set V2 on the MCP SPEED window. Set flaps 5, power up to 40% N1 till moving, then press 'd' button. Rotate at VR. Flightdirectors will show you required pitch.
Takeoff Flaps 5 Landing Gross lbs V1 VR V2 | 40 30 15 -------------------|--------------- 143000 154 155 160 | 152 153 165 132000 147 148 154 | 145 147 158 121000 140 141 148 | 138 141 151 110000 133 133 141 | 131 134 144 99000 123 133 133 | 123 127 136 88000 114 114 126 | 115 119 128 77000 104 104 117 | 107 111 119
Maximum Flap Operating Speeds 1 = 230 kts | 15 = 195 kts 2 = 230 kts | 25 = 190 kts 5 = 225 kts | 30 = 185 kts 10 = 210 kts | 40 = 158 kts
Landing Gear Limits - Extend 270kts / 0.82M - Retract 235kts

key.name: Down
key.desc: Elevator up or increase autopilot altitude
Elevator down or decrease autopilot altitude

key.name: Up
key.desc: Elevator down or decrease autopilot altitude
Move aileron right (or adjust AP heading.)

key.name: Right
key.desc: Move aileron right (or adjust AP heading.)
Move aileron left (or adjust AP heading.)

key.name: Left
key.desc: Move aileron left (or adjust AP heading)
